comment.author: 88342028@N00
comment._content:
Hi!
We've got a great team here in the Digital Lab--the 3 Sarahs, Anita, Alana, Katie, Christine, and Ruth, not to speak of our trusty volunteers and ever-changing group of interns. Which is a good thing, considering how much great stuff there is here at the Museum! Probably the biggest task is deciding what we should do next.

We'll keep you posted! 
And thanks -- it's great hearing from people who really care about our stuff and what we do with it!
Deb

comment.author: 25306332@N05
comment._content:
Hi Deb! , Just watched your youtube presentation " William Henry Goodyear and the Paris Exposition of 1900" .Enjoyed it very very much  thank you for posting this .  

Like you I  too scan, but  for my online Archive , in my spare time . First 2000 photos were uploaded using dial-up    .. Now I have hugesnet.com which makes scanning manageable .  

Thanks Again 
Joe Bott

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Hi Joe,
It's a big job and lots of somebodies have to do it! And let's hear it for DSL at home and even faster connections at work. Things have changed a lot since we started all of this digitization about 10 years ago.
Glad you liked the video. It was a fun presentation to put together. The Goodyear pics we have on the Commons are awesome and I'm tickled that so many people can now see them.
Happy New Year,
Deb
